intro: Tithymalus discolor, commonly known as the variable tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a distinctive disc-shaped center surrounded by ray florets. Tithymalus discolor is often found in open grasslands and along rocky outcrops, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
